snippet: While Mitt Romney frequently takes aim at China’s business practices on the campaign trail, Bain Capital, the private equity firm founded by Mr. Romney, has embraced the country, The New York Times reports.
abstract: While Mitt Romney frequently takes aim at China’s business practices on the campaign trail, Bain Capital, the private equity firm founded by Mr. Romney, has embraced the country, The New York Times reports.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

lead_paragraph: While Mitt Romney frequently takes aim at China’s business practices on the campaign trail, Bain Capital, the private equity firm founded by Mr. Romney, has embraced the country, The New York Times reports. Bain was interested in China when Mr. Romney ran the firm, and several of its portfolio companies have relocated jobs to Chinese factories. (The campaign says that Mr. Romney’s investments since 2003 have been held in a blind trust.) Read more »

headline.main: While Romney Attacks China on Trade, Bain Embraces It
